newsitem.title: TANZANIA: TNT sees fast growth in Tanzania air market.
newsitem.headline: TNT sees fast growth in Tanzania air market.

text.p: Tanzania's air cargo market has grown rapidly over the past few years and in particular the domestic market is now showing signs of big potential, TNT Express World-wide said on Tuesday.
Two years after establishing a licensed representative office in Tanzania, TNT has experienced growth of over 100 percent a year," Brian Holder, Managing Director of TNT's local office here said.
"We opened our own office here because the potential is good. Business has been good and it's growing all the time. The total market for express mail is growing," Holder told Reuters.

He estimated the total market for courier mail in Tanzania to be worth some $3 million a year, most of which contains the shipment of documents, and an increasing part of which is taken up by the domestic market.

He said the north-western district surrounding Tanzania's second city of Mwanza at Lake Victoria, where the country's rapidly developing mining industry is located, in particular was seen as a high-growth area.

"Most of the business is documents and small parcels but another interesting aspect of the business is the domestic market, the shipments within the country, where I can see a big potential for growth.
"Mwanza is a huge area for business with the mining industry being the most important which of course brings in the banking services as well and then there is some cotton business," Holder said.

He said TNT daily was shipping cargo with the local private airline Precision Air and the state-owned Air Tanzania Corporation to Mwanza, as well as to Arusha and Moshi in the country's northern coffee growing region.

"We have seen a 100 percent growth every year since opening our office in February 1995, inbound and outbound cargo is pretty balanced," he said, but declined to give any figures for the volume handled by TNT due to commercial reasons.
Holder said one of the biggest problems facing the air cargo industry in Tanzania was poor security at the airports and a lack of facilities.
While some improvements lately had been made in the security area there was "still a long way to go" before the situation would be fully satisfying, he said.
"Security at the airport is a huge problem, anyone can just walk into that airport, but I should say there has been improvements.

"The whole area of cargo handling could need some advice and rehabilitation. And the clearing process needs streamlining, it can take three or four days to clear a consignment of spareparts," he said.
In Tanzania TNT is also agent for KLM Royal Dutch Airlines' cargo operation.

Holder also noted express mail companies registered as a courier service in Tanzania, contrary to other countries in the East African region, had to pay a special annual registration fee of $30,000. - Reuters Air Cargo Newsroom Tel +44 171 542 7706 Fax +5017
